tags.name: Ninja
tags.description: Prominently features Japanese warriors traditionally trained in espionage, sabotage and assasination.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

node.description:
Nishio graduated from Nagoya Designer Academy and started his career at Anime Spot, a subcontracting studio, after being refused in interviews with several animation studios. He debuted as an in-betweener on [Osomatsu-kun](https://anilist.co/anime/9883/) and as a key animator on [Laughing Salesman](https://anilist.co/anime/3077/).

It's on [Yu Yu Hakusho](https://anilist.co/anime/392//) that Nishio came into his own as an animator, developing weighty and realistic movements influenced by [Satoru Utsunomiya](https://anilist.co/staff/101489/). Thanks to the ability demonstrated there, he was chosen to design the characters for [Ninku](https://anilist.co/anime/912/).

After working as character designer and chief animation director on [Jin-Roh](https://anilist.co/anime/570/) he permanently joined Production I.G. where he became known, together with [Hiroyuki Okiura](https://anilist.co/staff/103502/) and [Kazuchika Kise](https://anilist.co/staff/115781/), as "The Three Gods of I.G."

[Masashi Kishimoto](https://anilist.co/staff/96879/) requested for Nishio to be the character designer of the Naruto anime.

In August 2020, he was promoted to company director of Production I.G alongside [Takayuki Gotou](https://anilist.co/staff/103266/Takayuki-Gotou/), a co-founder of the studio.

Formerly affiliated with [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/) and [Ordet](https://anilist.co/studio/334/). He was one of the people to follow [Yutaka Yamamoto](https://anilist.co/staff/101655/) to Ordet after its establishment. After leaving Kyoto Animation he primarily used the pen name Gorou Sessha and became well known for his work in the [Naruto](https://anilist.co/anime/20/) franchise. His directorial debut was [Naruto: Rock Lee & His Ninja Pals](https://anilist.co/anime/12979/) which he directed from episode 27 onwards under the supervision of [Masahiko Murata](https://anilist.co/staff/102608/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/936428941) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/sekibeing/) | [Weibo](https://weibo.com/u/1948805307)

Huang is a Chinese web animator who started in Candybox studio, then moved to Studio Pierrot & now currently found his own studio “GEAR studio”.

Masashi Kishimoto is a Japanese manga artist, well known for creating the manga series [Naruto](https://anilist.co/manga/30011/Naruto/). His younger twin brother, [Seishi Kishimoto](https://anilist.co/staff/96897/Seishi-Kishimoto), is also a manga artist and creator of the manga series [666 Satan](https://anilist.co/manga/30032/OParts-Hunter/) and [Blazer Drive](https://anilist.co/manga/36612/Blazer-Drive/). He is good friends with [Eiichirou Oda](https://anilist.co/staff/96881/Eiichirou-Oda)

__[Website](http://www.flow-official.jp/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCLakaKEelmUdqQISLjwIRmg)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/FLOWofficial.music)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/FLOW_official)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/FLOW_OFFICIAL_JAPAN/)__

FLOW is a Japanese rock band that formed in 1998 and is signed on to Sony Music Japan's Ki/oon Records label. Flow is a five-piece band made up of two vocalists, a drummer, a bassist and a guitarist.

__Members:__
- [Keigo Hayashi](https://anilist.co/staff/227206/Keigo) (林圭吾) | KEIGO  - Vocalist
- [Kohshi Asakawa](https://anilist.co/staff/160032) (浅川甲史) | KOHSHI - Vocalist, Occasional rhythm guitarist
- [Takeshi Asakawa](https://anilist.co/staff/160033) (浅川岳史) | TAKE  - Lead Guitarist
- Hiroshi Iwasaki | IWASAKI (岩崎博詞) - Drummer
- Yasutaro Gotou | GOT'S (後藤康太郎) - Bass

__[Official Site](https://ikimonogakari.com/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCflAJoghlGeSkdz5eNIl-sg)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/IKIMONOofficial)__

__ikimono-gakari__ (いきものがかり) is a Japanese rock band. They record on Sony Music Japan's EPIC Records label.  The band was formed in Kanagawa Prefecture in February 1999 by Hotaka Yamashita and [Yoshiki Mizuno](https://anilist.co/staff/168854/Yoshiki-Mizuno), and was later joined by lead vocalist [Kiyoe Yoshioka](https://anilist.co/staff/159004) in December the same year. Hotaka Yamashita later left the band as of July 2021.

[Official Site](https://www.sambomaster.co) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/sambomaster_txt)

**Sambomaster** is a Japanese rock band signed by Sony Music Japan.  Trivia: The band's name, Sambomaster, refers to the Russian martial art called Sambo.

Members:

- Takashi Yamaguchi  (山口隆) - Lead Vocals, Guitar
- Yasufumi Kiuchi (木内泰史) - Drums, Chorus
- Yoichi Kondou (近藤洋) - Bass, Chorus

__Members:__
- Maguro Taniguchi (lead vocals, rhythm guitar) - [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kanaboonmaguro) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/taniguchi_maguro)
- Hayato Koga (lead guitar, backing vocals) - [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kanaboontuna) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kanaboontuna)
- Takahiro Koizumi (drums) - [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kanaboonkoicha)

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kanaboon_official_insta) |  [Twitter](https://twitter.com/_kanaboon) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/KANABOONVEVO/) | [Official Website](https://sp.kanaboon.jp/) 

A Japanese rock band formed in 2008, currently associated with Ki/oon Music. They've had four albums reach the top ten on the weekly Oricon Albums Chart. They have also had five singles reach the top ten on the weekly Oricon Singles Chart.

(Source: Wikipedia)

name.native: アジアン・カンフー・ジェネレーション

node.description:
[Website](http://www.asiankung-fu.com) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/AKG_information) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC52_sWDVAOwq5TaaA44kp-A)

Asian Kung-Fu Generation, stylized as ASIAN KUNG-FU GENERATION, is a Japanese alternative rock band formed in 1996.

Starting out as a college band, they released a series of independent EPs featuring lyrics mostly sung in English. In 2002, they released their major-label EP debut Hokai Amplifier, from that point singing their lyrics in Japanese. The band's musical style is influenced by seminal Western alternative rock acts as well as their own local Japanese indie-rock and punk scene. Their songs incorporate various aspects of the genres, most typically expressing fast tempos and prominent power chord guitar riffs in addition to rhythmic groove and emotional lyrics. Despite the indie nature of their music, the band has enjoyed worldwide commercial success in addition to critical acclaim.

They have also been cited as one of the best, most balanced modern rock bands to emerge from Japan in the '00s.

__Members:__
- [Masafumi Gotou](https://anilist.co/staff/159934/) - vocalist
- [Kensuke Kita](https://anilist.co/staff/220702/) - guitarist
- [Takahiro Yamada](https://anilist.co/staff/159937/) - bassist
- [Kiyoshi Ijichi](https://anilist.co/staff/220703/) - drummer

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ogura_koubou)

In 1977, Ogura joined *Kobayashi Production* and learned the ropes of art direction under [Shichirou Kobayashi](https://anilist.co/staff/103964/Shichirou-Kobayashi). In 1983 he left and established Studio Fuga together with Kouji Oono and [Toshiharu Mizutani](https://anilist.co/staff/121908/Toshiharu-Mizutani). There he eventually left as well and formed his own 'Ogura Kobo' at Production I.G., where he trains newer art directors. He continues to be a major presence at Production I.G. as one of their most prominent art directors.

Ogura's style is, similar to Kobayashi's, rooted in imposing architecture, ambient colors, and Western perspectives versus traditional Japanese isometric perspectives. Ogura's backgrounds are usually urban in setting and has a less saturated color palette, and uses more cool than warm colors. Ogura's fantastical, European Kobayashi influence is easily seen in [Wings of Honneamise](https://anilist.co/anime/1034/Ouritsu-Uchuugun-Honneamise-no-Tsubasa/), and his later work has remained distinctly metropolitan, something that can be seen even in the rural [FLCL](https://anilist.co/anime/227/FLCL/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/2894227226) | [Tumblr](https://henrythurlow.tumblr.com/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/HTAnimations) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/HenryThurlowAnimator)

Formerly affiliated with [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/) between 2021 and 2024.

Graduated Pratt Institute with a Bachelor in Fine Arts in Animation in 2006.
